newsitem.title: USA: CSCE cocoa weaker but within range, volume light.
newsitem.headline: CSCE cocoa weaker but within range, volume light.

text.p: CSCE cocoa prices were weaker in listless dealings ahead of midday, hit by speculative selling and pressure on the nearby switch, traders said.
Light speculative selling took hold of the market from the outset, dealers said, with currency-related arbitrage on the back months accelerating the downtrend.

A move by operators to roll spot positions into second-month May ahead of March's delivery period also weighed on the market, they said. March goes into notice period on February 14, one month before its expiration.
"People are looking to start rolling now that the spreads have stabilized a bit," said one broker. Scale-down buying by manufacturers and commission houses provided some support, he said.
At 1144 EST, March was $10 a tonne lower, at $1,306, having traded from $$1,303 to $1,314. May was $12 lower, at $1,336. Volume reached a scant 1,581 lots as of 1100 EST.

Technically, March would need to hold above $1,292-1,294 to avoid retesting the contract low of $1,259 set last week. To the upside, resistance was noted at today's highs of $1,314-1,316 and then at $1,323-1,327.
((-- Wendy Pollack, New York Commodities Desk +1 212 859 1640))
